name: Conditionals & hypotheticals
description: Major conditional frames (と・たら・なら・ば) plus common N2/N1 conditional idioms for nuance.

entries.meaning: when / whenever / if (natural or automatic result, general truth)
entries.example_jp: 春になると、桜が咲きます。
entries.example_en: When spring comes, cherry blossoms bloom.
notes_grammar: Often for natural consequence/habit; not for speaker's intention/commands.

entries.meaning: if / when (after something happens; flexible conditional)
entries.example_jp: 雨が降ったら、家にいます。
entries.example_en: If it rains, I will stay home.

entries.meaning: if it is the case that / given that (based on context or topic)
entries.example_jp: 日本に行くなら、京都に行きたいです。
entries.example_en: If I go to Japan, I want to go to Kyoto.

entries.meaning: if (formal, logical conditional; focuses on condition)
entries.example_jp: 時間があれば、映画を見ます。
entries.example_en: If I have time, I will watch a movie.

entries.example_jp: もし時間があるなら、一緒に行きませんか。
entries.example_en: If you have time, would you like to go together?

entries.example_jp: あなたさえ来れば、みんな喜びます。
entries.example_en: If only you come, everyone will be happy.

entries.example_jp: 急がないと間に合わない。
entries.example_en: If we don't hurry, we won't make it.
I'll go even if it rains.

entries.meaning: it would be good if; hope/suggestion
entries.example_jp: 明日晴れるといいですね。
entries.example_en: I hope it will be sunny tomorrow.

entries.example_jp: もっと早く聞けばよかった。
駅に着いたところ、電車が出たあとだった。
entries.example_en: When I arrived at the station, the train had already left.

entries.example_jp: 知っているかぎり、彼は無実です。
entries.example_en: As far as I know, he is innocent.

entries.meaning: on (a particular day) of all times; ironically
entries.example_jp: こういう日にかぎって雨が降る。
entries.example_en: It rains on days like this of all times.

entries.meaning: if (but it's unlikely); if you were to
entries.example_jp: 今そんなことを言おうものなら、怒られる。
entries.example_en: If you were to say that now, you'd get scolded.

entries.example_jp: もう少し安くならないものか。
entries.example_en: Isn't there some way it could get a bit cheaper?

entries.example_jp: もし私が社長だとしたら、制度を変える。
entries.example_en: If I were the president, I'd change the system.

entries.meaning: when it comes to; once it becomes
entries.example_jp: 年末ともなると忙しくなる。
entries.example_en: When it gets to year-end, it gets busy.

entries.example_jp: こんなに寝ては、疲れが取れない。
entries.example_en: If you sleep this much, you won't recover.
